content:
# The furnace is now working again, but it shows "NO_FUEL," indicating that it has run out of coal despite having 9 coal in the inventory.
# The furnace currently has 6 iron ore left and has produced a total of 8 iron plates.

# Our inventory remains:
# - 8 wood
# - 10 coal
# - 5 stone

# We need to ensure that the furnace has enough fuel to continue smelting. Let's insert more coal into the furnace.

# I will insert 5 coal into the furnace to ensure it has enough fuel for the smelting process.
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, furnace, quantity=5)

# Check the furnace status and inventory after this insertion
furnace_inventory = inspect_inventory(furnace)
print(f"Furnace Inventory after adding coal: {furnace_inventory}")
print(f"Furnace Status after adding coal: {furnace.status}")  # Check status again

# Now, I will wait again to see if more iron plates are produced.
for _ in range(30):  # Wait for up to 30 seconds
    furnace_inv = inspect_inventory(furnace)
    if furnace_inv[Prototype.IronPlate] > 8:  # Check if any additional iron plates have been produced
        break
    sleep(1)

print(f"Final Inventory after smelting again: {inspect_inventory()}")
print(f"Entities on the map: {get_entities()}")
